Warning possible Spoilers
The Devil is a Part Timer is probably one of the funniest anime's I've seen, mainly because it sounds like an interesting concept while also having a fantastic mixture of characters to keep you entertained plus you'll never look at a McDonald's or a KFC the same again once you've finished watching this.
The story begins in Ente Isla where the Demon Lord Saturn has been vanquished by humanity so he along with one of his generals escape to Earth to rebuild their empire, but with the interruption of Emilia the hero and earning very poor salaries their conquest of Earth isn't going tobe that easy.

Honestly it surprised the hell out of me that Saturn working at a discount McDonald's called MgRonald's would actually be a fun and enjoyable story, it was really entertaining seeing the characters that came from Ente Isla trying to get used to living in normal human society and it makes me think this is how well aliens would do in our society if they ever appear, but nonetheless the interactions and situations between the characters during their day to day lives was just absolutely funny because Saturn or Sadao Maou and Emilia or Emi Yusa completely hate each others guts yet seeing them along with the other Ente Isla characters and the human characters their relationship did start to get more comfortable because they had learned more about each other and what they are really like, hell they even worked together sometimes to take down bad guys.

I think whats also pretty funny is how serious this show can be sometimes because even though he works at MgRonalds Saturn takes his job very seriously so seeing him taking to out other fast food places for customers was weirdly inspiring because you would never see a McDonald's employee doing this kind of stuff because their usually just Zombies trying to make some money, plus it's anime which can turn even the stupidest and boring of things into something awesome that is if it is done right like this.

I also have to give props to the developers for creating another language just for Ente Isla which is something you very rarely see down in anime's even if they are set in fantasy worlds they always use Japanese or English yet this decides to go and create another language which really reminded me of Lord of the Rings since that has it's own languages too along with any other fantasy type thing.


Now even though the characters constantly bicker with each other their chemistry is fantastic and always makes for some great entertainment.

Saturn/Sadao Maou is the male MC, he was the recent Demon King of Ente Isla until Emilia forced him to retreat to Earth though you wouldn't expect such a cool guy to be the Demon King because Sadao is such a good character true he does say from time to time he is going to conquer this world, but I feel like he does that to piss off Emilia he is actually a thoughtful person and makes sure that everyone is ok especially when it comes to his co-worker Chiho, although he can be a bit oblivious and a douchebag sometimes, but that douchebagness is mainly towards Emilia because obviously their enemies.

Emilia/Emi Yusa is the female MC who is half human and half angel which gives her the power to defeat Saturn, Emi is also a Tsundere which is actually understandable since she is having to live close to her enemy that she wants to destroy because he pretty destroyed everything she cared for back in Ente Isla, but the constant bickering that she and Maou have makes most people think they used to be in a romantic relationship and are just trying to make each other's lives hell, Emi is actually a very funny character since she has to get involved with things that concern Sadou that she really doesn't want to get involved, but has to in case he tries anything evil however despite being his enemy Emi does have a kind heart and slowly starts to get on better terms with him by the end of the series.

Chiho Sasaki or Chi for short is the only human from Earth that is a main character and she is such a fun, cheerful and adorable character, she works alongside Sadou at the MgRonald's and does develop feelings for him and those feelings get stronger even after she finds out he is the Devil and the things he has done, but because of this connection she does get caught up in dangerous situations and having the others rescue then again she doesn't have powers so you can't really blame her plus her strong feelings for Sadou do make her jealous of the other girls when they do something with Sadou that she doesn't like which does lead to some temper tantrum's though this didn't annoy and sometimes seemed pretty cute.

Azazel/Shirou Ashiya is one of Saturn's general's and Roommate on Earth though from the way he acts you'd think he's more of a strict mother than a Demon general, he ends up being the cook of the house and makes sure that him and Saturn have the balanced diet they need and also makes sure they don't waste money on pointless things, however as funny as his tantrum's are when the others don't listen to him he does end up being in a sickened state for almost half of the series making him not seem for a good amount of time which did suck since he was a funny and entertaining character.

Lucifer/Hanzou Urushihara who used to be one of Saturn's demon generals until he was supposedly killed by Emi that is until he showed up on Earth to cause havoc until Sadou and the others stopped him then he became an addition to Sadou's household which seems oddly weird keeping a guy who tried to kill you as a roommate, he is very lazy and becomes a NEET playing video games and wasting the others money for pointless stuff, but he is clever and did manage to help save the day by planting trackers on some of the characters to know their whereabouts which helped Sadou in a battle, plus he is always looked down upon by the others and his reaction are just priceless because he hates being used by them as a joke then again he did try to kill them and does waste their money on pointless stuff.

Crestia Bel/Suzuno Kamazuki is an executioner for the Church Investigation Commission in Ente Isla and came to Earth to see why Emi and Sadou were in a kind of alliance, she starts out as a kind and caring neighbour to the demon boys often cooking them food and helping them out with daily chores when Shirou was out of action which she only does so she can eliminate Sadou, when she began living on Earth she didn't understand how anything worked until Emi helped her out and despite being an assassin she is actually a good person at heart and never really wanted to kill people which she only did because the church ordered her too.


The artstyle was actually pretty good and I liked the character designs because there felt like a difference between the characters from Ente Isla and Earth with their appearance's true the Demon boys were in human form, but they didn't seem human and when Sadou did turn into his demon form he looked friggin badass certainly the form you would expect the Demon King to look like and from the way Ente Isla looked I kinda wanted to see more of it because it would seem like an interesting place to be.


The comedy is definitely what makes this a great anime and the comedy works incredibly well because of the characters which I have said before from their interactions with each other, most anime's decide to use random situations or accidental mishaps to make funny comedy, but The Devil is a Part Timer use's the characters as the source of comedy and their arguments are so funny, usually you'd arguments between the main characters would be annoying, but they used these arguments to great effect and pulled off some really funny moments.


However this anime can actually be pretty serious because along with the bits of action there are some instances with the characters that gives you a very serious tone like when Emi shouts at Sadou about the things he did in Ente Isla and how it affected her and the humans of Ente Isla, the action sequences themselves are actually pretty good and aren't really flashy which is mainly due to the Ente Isla characters not being able to use a lot of magic since there isn't a concentration of it on Earth so don't expect the fights to be amazingly epic, their pretty short, but are still sweet to watch especially when Sadou goes all Demon mode.


Despite there being Romance in the genre tags there isn't really a whole lot of it because the only character who has romantic feelings for Sadou is Chi, but whenever she tries to flirt with him or even when she reveals her feelings to him Sadou doesn't really return those feelings to her since he respects her as a co-worker and friend while with Emi it's more of a building trust relationship since they are sworn enemies, but by the end they have kinda started to trust each other.

What also surprise's me is the Ecchi or fanservice in this anime because I originally thought it had quite a lot, but aside from a pool episode and a few bath and undressing scene's there really wasn't that much and yes I know Chi has a pretty big oppai, but it doesn't really ruin her character or any of the scene's unless it's being used for fanservice, but I was surprised how controlled the fanservice was.


Overall this is a incredibly fun anime and I would definitely recommend this to anyone if they are looking for a good laugh just don't expect the next time you walk into McDonald's seeing Saturn or a sexy Loli.

Honestly it's a great show and kind of sad that it doesn't have a season 2. Overall there isn't many things wrong that are needed to be point out. 
If i did have to say something that i didn't like is that the pacing seemed to go by really fast at times. But this happens very little in the show.
The show doesn't answer some things that i would expect in some situations but it isn't so much as the show's fault as it is the amount of episodes the season had. If there was even maybe 3 or 4 more episodes i think they couldhave fixed that.


Also i really love Emi character and like the relationship between her and the Overlord. Kind of wish the show showed her being more of a badass sense we are told all through out how powerful she is. But there isn't many times when we see how powerful she is.

[Part 1] This part aims to help you to decide whether to watch the show or not.
In a nutshell:
You should watch this show if:
- You're searching a lighthearted show, but with a FUN STORY that actually makes you eager to see the end
- You like comedy, because it WILL MAKE you laugh at least few times almost every episode. 
- You want to see some out-of-the-box characters.
You should NOT watch if you:
- Hate incomplete stories, because almost everyone who liked the anime yearned for the second season to see the development
- Are looking for a serious, balanced premise to the story, because there are plotholes that may irritate you in this \n\n
[Part 2] About the categories to evaluate:\n\n
Story - 8. \n
It starts off with a very amusing premise and quickly jumps to the main setting that'll be the main theme of all anime. The development rate is amazing. 13 Eps can be categorized as following: 2 small stories withing a main story where the set of events happen and end quickly, the second one ending at the ep. 12. \n
Overall, it's a very good story for this anime.\n\n
Comedy - 8.\n
I put comedy as a separate category because that's of the main assets of the show. I laughed pretty hard to some scenes, giggled to others. Overall the comedy served its purpose, not to the fullest though\n\n
Sound - 7\n
Above average because there were unique OST fitting perfectly to a scene. \n\n
Enjoyment - 9\n
The only reason I can't give 10 to the enjoyment it gave me, is that I can't help but compare this nomination to other animes which kept me hours and hours stuck to the monitor wondering what'd happen next. \n\n
Other than that, fast paced development of events, good comedy (noticeably attractive face expressions being part of it), awesome fighting scenes (although few) make the anime well worth watching.\n\n
Overall - 8\n
Which makes me happy thinking its public score is well deserved. If I were to describe this anime in one line, I'd say:\n\n
"A balanced fun show for its story and characters with some pretty fights here and there"

As an amateur film critic, and not so much anime critic, I found it terrifically difficult to find a comedy anime that truly fit in my comedic standards without being unwatchable at times; an anime that I could genuinely, and at that hysterically, laugh at. "Hataraku Maou-sama!" is the first that lands in that category.
From the onset, the show presents itself with a not too serious plot with colorful characters and bouncy dialogue that meshes well with each character. The story is not complicated, however diverges from its origin quickly to focus on the characters and the real value of the show which serves themood of it better than anything. As a comedy, the show does not have to create a hyper-intensive plot that engrosses the audience. However, what it does do with its plot is much more detailed than any comedic anime I've seen and adds a touch to an already colorful show. Even with a plot not too focused on the grand stage, the comedic plot between characters never goes anywhere and never seems to progress; ideas such as the bonding of Maou and Emi could have been enhanced to create a more emotional feeling from the viewer. Just because it does not have to be intensive, that does not mean that subplots cannot be slightly more honed. 


The style of the anime is just as simple as its plot which added little to the feeling of the show. However, where there are some small bland spots in the animation, in very specific episodes it ramps up to a level most anime of this caliber do not attempt. Demonic fight scenes were a nice touch as it let the animators show-off for an episode or two. While brief parts were beautiful, the art does not do much in the way of generating a feeling or striking the audience; leave the writing to do that. 


The soundtrack is nothing special in my opinion. I've never been one to seek out a specific track in a show unless it REALLY reaches out to me which puts me in a 'meh' state for the OST of the show. The voice work, however is what is nice about the sound of the show. Both Japanese and English in my opinion have great performances, specifically Chi in the Japanese dub (SO F#!@N' CUTE) and Ashiya and Urushihara from the English dub (They both capture their characters so well). With an unknown OST but pretty good overall Voice acting, the sound is one that does not quite jump out to myself. 


This is where it gets exciting. These characters portray some incredible writing work. The comedy from each individual is pure and displays the variety of characters that is in the show. The characters showcase real emotion (a debt to the voice actors/actresses), and they mesh with each other so well. The designs may not be the most original, with many archetypes being used to embody a singular character, however they still connect to the audience and get laughs out of them. Favorite characters include Urushihara, Chi, and Sariel. The characters are so well written to bounce off each other that they create a connection to each other and the viewer which is paramount in a comedic show with a short run-time. 


This hit me at just the right time and is perfect for a palette-cleanser after a thoughtful show. The comedy is funny, enjoyable and relatable as are the characters. The simplicity of the show holds it back from being incredible and the length hinders its advancements too. As a comedy, this show is an immediate recommendation, however rudimentary and/or immature. You don't watch this to analyze it as it achieves its purpose with flying colors.

Overall Score- 3/4 Stars | WATCH IT!

-winger61

I don't even want to start this off with a quote or something to grab anyone's attention because this show didn't really grab mine, so let's just hop to it.
Storyline: The storyline was unique. The demon lord, Satan himself, goes head-to-head with the hero, Emilia, and ends up escaping into another "world" (Japan). He and his right-hand man, Alciel, decide to adapt to the culture, move in together, get jobs, blend into society, etc. But Satan's buddy can't hold down a job, so it's up to him to be the bread winner. He gets a job at a fast food joint and totally kicks ass.He's the best of the best and is able to charm his coworkers. Kind of a weird quirk for a fricking demon, but whatever? He eventually runs into Emilia who now goes by "Emi" and she still vows to kill him at all costs. Meanwhile, people from their world (Ente Isla) keep appearing and somehow have lots of power all the time, but Satan and Emilia can't seem to muster up their strength. I get that Satan gets stronger from feeding off fear, but come on. I mean, he's SATAN. But okay. They beat the baddies and then befriend them. Makes sense. Because the anime only has one season, it fell short. There were no clear goals or resolutions. The only thing that made this somewhat entertaining was the mediocre comedy.


Art: As far as art goes, it was basic. Nothing was amazing. No jaw-dropping fight scenes or anything. 


Sound: The characters' voices were fine, I guess? And the music... I don't really remember it. I guess it didn't really stick out much.


Characters: Satan has zero character development whatsoever. He was supposed to be almighty before and now he's content with living a normal life without being bad? Why? No clear answer. It's basically "just because". Emilia is fricking annoying. She's a stalker and has to remind you every five miliseconds that she's "the hero", but also vows to kill all the bad guys. Now how does that work out? As for the side characters, they're all rats. They all kind of suck, every girl is obsessed with Satan, and the men are dramatic.


Overall: I gave this show a 6. I should rate it lower, but whatever. I find this fair. I made it through all 13 episodes. Anything is possible, I suppose. I wouldn't recommend this show, but I didn't hate it.

McDonalds. The devil. Put these two together and the hilarious mess you get is Hataraku Maou-sama!
If you think of the devil, you will probably not think of a man struggling to pay for his daily expenses while working a part-time job at a local McDonalds. However, this show will completely throw your perspective around and make you long for a delicious burger.
While the art of Hataraku Maou-sama! isn't anything special compared to most shows out there, it does have some pretty vivid colors to mess around even more with the aspect of the devil himself being the protagonist of the story.
The OST isn't one ofthe best I've heard in anime, but it matches the show pretty well and while it does not stand out a lot, it blends in with the art of the show, making it easy to watch. \n
What truly makes this anime so great is the story and the character design. The anime takes some of the most fearsome creatures from religion and throw them into the most mundane life you could ever imagine. Not accustomed to the human world, you will see how the so-called "demon lord" and fellow otherworldly characters struggle to adapt to the human society. Comedy being one of the main parts of the show, you'll probably notice how even the smallest things will make you laugh due to the context they're showed in. \n\n
Another part which I really loved of this anime is the clever details they added, such as the wordplay with the character names. (Urushihara being Lucifer. Try pronouncing them, trust me.) \n\n
This anime is basically a hilarious show you could easily watch in one go if you've got the time. The comedy combined with the totally out-of-place slice of life aspect and a little bit of action delivers you a great show which is definitely worth an 8/10 in my opinion.

I was looking for an action-comedy with supernatural elements but I didn't find what I wanted. 
The intrusion of "everyday life" elements during the battles is indeed funny but the jokes always look the same from one episode to the other. At the end you even don't laugh anymore as it is so repetitive...
Concerning the action, I was also disappointed because it does not occupy a lot of time on screen. And the supernatural is not very present neither as the protagonists are mainly in their human form. 
Other negative points include the quickly forgotten soundtrack and the poor character development. Instead of adding newcharacters every two episodes, they should have more explained the background of all the existing characters. Emi Yusa does not understand the transition of Sadao. We spectators neither. And what about the other demons? It is maybe done on purpose but in my opinion it does not make any sense.\n\n
Finally this anime is more a slice of life with easy comedy elements. Although I can't say I didn't enjoy it at all, it will be quickly forgotten. Watch it at 11 pm when you have nothing else to do. \n\n

***This is a spoiler free review***
Anime has recently been on a trend of light hearted comedy shows with a heavy emphasis on “moe”. While Hataraku Maou-sama embodies many of these elements, it is surprisingly enjoyable to watch. It also redeems this season by turning this great light novel into a non-mediocre anime (*cough* Date A Live *cough*). 
Story: 7/10
The plot in Hataraku Maou-sama flows surprisingly well from the beginning all the way towards to the ending. The main focus of the show is on the Demon King Sadao who after losing a battle with the humans flees to Earth through a portal. Not wanting theDemon King to get away, The Hero Emi follows the Demon King to the human earth. The first couple episodes really made me interested in the direction the show wanted to go because the plot introduced my favorite type of character; the fish out of water character. When you have a character dropped into a situation with absolutely no understanding of what is going on around him, you (the audience) has the perfect opportunity to learn with the main character. Since everything has to be spelled out for him, you in turn get to learn everything along with him thus making the experience much more fluid. Granted Sadao does get on his feet rather quickly finding a job and a place to live early on, the first episode was very funny as he and his minion Shirou had to deal with the Japanese culture and police. The only issue with the pacing of the show was that the ending was not really an ending at all and that the one sided love that Chiho expresses feels a little forced. The show did not go out of its way to give us a huge, thought provoking experience but it did not cause me to fall asleep watching it.


As I stated in the opening sentence of this review, this show is a comedy. To be more specific this show is a gag comedy meaning that a lot of people will not like the short jab of jokes. Also a lot of the jokes are centered on Japanese common knowledge things such as their healthcare system. There is also a huge emphases on “moe” or super cute girls that you just want to hug the ever living s#!t out of. There is a moderate amount of fan service in the show but it really did not overly distract me from what was going on.


Animation: 8.4/10


The animation for me was pretty excellent. There are some truly awesome quality shots in this anime such as the scene in daylight under the trees in the park in the last episode or the final fight scene in episode twelve. The character models are also very well done and seeing how this is a very “cute girl” anime, the females all have their unique charm. I think it is safe to say that Chiho is now the most adorable anime girl with huge boobs. I just want to give them…err her a big ol’ hug.


Sound: 6/10


The only noteworthy awesome thing about the sound in this anime was the performance of the voice actors. I absolutely loved the voice of each character in the anime regardless if they had a major or minor role. Other than that though I felt like the show’s sound was average. The music choices for the show felt bland and didn’t really help make the show any better.


Characters: 7/10


Emi, Sadao, Lucifer, and Shirou all made this show extremely fun to watch. Their back and forth bantering brought many funny and enjoying moments throughout the show’s first season. We also had our fill of super cute…err female leads! Each of the three main females in the show has varying personalities. Emi is the really cold and ruthless one, Chiho has a really cheerful attitude (and huge boobs), and the other female lead Suzuno I won’t talk about so I do not spoil anything but she turned out to be my favorite. I mean even Emi's friend Rika is just oozing cuteness on an unfathomable level. This show does have a lot of “moe” elements but it is not putting all of its eggs into this basket. The plot flows so well because of the character interactions; the cuteness is just a super sweet add-on.


Overall: 7.1/10


This show was truly a surprise gift (for me at least) in this anime season. After seeing how much high school/slice of life stuff was coming, I thought that this was just going to be another one of those forgettable ones. This show had an interesting premise with the characters and animation to back it up. Even though the sound sort of took a back seat role, this anime really has everything it needs to keep pretty much everyone interested. If fanservice is an issue for you there really is only two or three scenes where they just throw it in your face so it should not be a huge issue.


Enjoyment: 7.8/10


Thanks for reading my review! If you liked my writing style, would like to see some other reviews, or just want to talk, please stop by my page!


Sincerely,

I personally enjoyed the anime from episodes 1-12. It was a real pick-me-up, and it made me burst out laughing multiple times over the humor. However, the ending was incredibly awful in my opinion. I was completely outraged over how poorly this anime ended. I was expecting something so much better than what happened and I'm pretty disappointed. I really wish they would have fixed it somehow (a movie, second season, more episodes). The ending just felt so rushed and the last episode felt more like a filler episode than a final conclusion. Maybe it ended differently in the manga, but I haven't read it.\n
Overall, I give it an 8/10 because of episode 13. The anime has amazing characters and plot development. It seemed like there was a lot put into the idea of it but the last episode just made me feel like maybe the anime was cancelled in the middle of production...

Some things do not mix. Oil and water. Love and logic. Oranges and toothpaste. And as far as entertainment goes, action and comedy. Not to say they are binary, no. Comic relief to break the pace of seriousness and action to sober up the silly work well together as long as they do not deviate from the tone of the show. The tone has to be dominant. When you try to mix equal parts comedy and action, it says to me, "If you're not taking this seriously, why should I?" And "The Devil is a Part-Timer!" from the renowned studio White Fox got me askingthat question more than once.


The premise is something out of a network sitcom. The Devil and one of his Generals are forced to leave their world and make a living in the hustle and bustle that is the big city. A fish out of water story is nothing new, but the idea that the most evil being in existence suddenly adapts modern sensibilities in the span of a single episode already has me doubting the premise. Was he THAT bad? The backstory speaks of genocide and destruction caused that hands of Satan and his generals, so he clearly was living up to the mythos- but now I'm supposed to like him because he's taking his job at MgRonald's with the same seriousness as he does conquering the lands of his home world? Okay, fine. There are some genuinely funny moments early on, but then to see the Hero show up and forgive all his evil deeds, too? Makes me feel they set the stakes way too high early on.


The show then slips into a slice of life type motif. The Devil reduced to a shift manager at a burger joint. His mighty General reduced to essentially a housewife. The Hero now a telephone operator. Dealing with things like rent, a creepy landlady, and the giggles that come when they're super serious in public over things that aren't serious at all. It was funny the first few times. I had a sense of relief when the backstory elements would creep back in, but then the conflicts there were resolved so quickly, it made me wonder why I was worried in the first place. The positives here are some nifty fight scenes and some good art and effects to go with them. I did enjoy the handful of battles here. The in show music along with the opening and ending themes are nothing special, but hardly awful. 


The story itself was rushed, but the characters still got enough of a chance to grow on you. Enough to warrant concern when the final battle takes place, but the show ends on a note that makes it feel like it just stops rather than actually having an ending. This was rather awkward and frustrating. I had a few laughs with this show and as far as the Sub vs. Dub battle goes, it's a win for the Sub with a performance that stood a cut above the English dubbers. The show felt rushed, repetitive, and confused in content and tone. There was so much going on in the world the Devil and Hero came from, I wanted the show to go over there! That seemed much more interesting than watching Satan's General being sick all the time. 


At the end of the day, the goofiness itself does make the show decent enough and enjoyable in some spots, but operating on the premise of our main character being the evilest of evil and letting all the go because he's human now and somewhat likeable makes unpleasant contrast in my opinion, had they gone less dark and serious in his background, I may have enjoyed it more. But the contrast is too sharp for me to ignore and asks too much of me as a viewer to accept. Overall, I give this show a strong 5/10. If you have nothing better to watch, check it out. Cheers!

There are very few animes that I enjoyed as much as I have this series, maybe because for such an unusual fantasy premise it feels so grounded at the same time. 
Story: In another world where every fantasy cliche takes place, the Demon king Satan is at war with the great hero and slowly starts to lose so as a last resort him and his right hand demon Alciel flee through a portal where they end up in our world in Japan and have the fish out of water moment to begin with but quickly transitions to them adapting to our world from renting anapartment and working part time at a Mc Donalds parody and doing a good job at it. While more characters are introduced and there are fantasy elements the main plot is just life and how we can relate to his situation of being on your own and working to make a living and that's one of the reasons why I love the story


Art: The art and animation is very nice standard and doesn't really do anything too out there, so there isn't much to say.


Sound: first off major kudos to the dub for really getting the characters voices down and extra points to Felecia Angelle who voices Emi for really getting that angry tone, the opening is nice to listen to and of course the japanese voice acting is done really well, I would give both a listen to.


Character: This is the main reason why I love this anime, every character is unique and the interaction between them is amazing, from the hero who comes off as a villain, Chiyo didn't irritate me as much as I thought she would, my favourite character is definitely Lucifer because I can relate to him a lot, as a matter of fact a lot of the characters I can relate to because they are written so well and are really funny. 


Enjoyment: I could not stop watching this anime and I was extremely sad once it ended, I tried reading the manga but it hasn't gone that far yet but I still hope for a second season, I know a lot of people might not have enjoyed this series as much as I have but I can guarantee it doesn't feel like a waste of time. 


Overall: It's a fantasy anime that has a very slice of life element to it that merges the two complete opposite genre's together so well that it can appeal to both fans. 10/10 would watch

I talk about this series all the time. I usually Call it a mix between a working sitcom and a fantasy Dramedy. You've got the Overlord Satan Conqueror of the world working at a fast food Burger Joint. Then you've got the Lovely red head hero who's come to end him once and for all, working at a call center and struggling desperately not to become a love interest. Tsundere's right? I'ts not like she likes him or anything right? BAKA! The show just has it all in my opinion. An amusing and interesting plot, Fun characters you can't help like and Douchey characters yalove to hate. It's an animated sitcom full of a lotta laughs, a little action and a whole lot of fun.


Hey, If you've already watched the series check out my You tube discussion and Review for the series. In the link below. Boy, I hope that's aloud.

Let me pitch this anime to you: SATAN at McDonalds. 
This anime.... this anime.... this anime is amazing. With the exception of Episode 13 (Which feels like a episode from an early 2nd season that might never be made.), all the episodes are on-point. I'm laughed my ass off throughout most the jokes. 
There's really not much to say about the art or sound. It's neatly executed.
It's the characters that make this show shine.
Satan, ruler of darkness, is ... a dork. 
Emilia, the all-powerful hero, is ... a dork.
Alciel, the most capable general the Devil has, is ... a dork.
Lucifer, the embodiment of chaos, is... a dork with a NEET streak.\n
Suzuno, the Devil's neighbor with her own mysterious backstory... is a dork. \n
Chiyo, the most adorable coworker you could possibly have, is ... not a dork, but still very endearing. And most of the comedy comes from her being the Devil's Underling (with a crush on him) in MgRonalds as they take on Sentucky Fried Chicken in sales. If you aren't cracking a grin from reading that sentence, you have no soul.\n\n
In all seriousness, you just sit back, cheer these characters on, and have yourself a viewing party of one because it is that good. The English Dub is available on iTunes. For about 26.99 plus tax, you can own all 13 episodes. Definitely the way to go. \n\n
Unfortunately, this falls in the same category  as Unbreakable Machine Doll and D-Frag, as a one-season hit full of strong, and endearing characters, that will PROBABLY NEVER GET A SECOND SEASON because the studios don't know when they have a hit. If Haganai and Chuunibyou could get second seasons, why can't these?\n

I recently re-watched this anime and I must say that it fills the hole in my heart when I am looking for something to watch. The anime is similar to the slice of life genre with an underlying story that moves the plot at a good pace. The characters provide great comedy and really question the morality of what is to be considered good and evil. The scenes with action are nicely animated and really shows the raw powers of the main character. If you like the anime Working! then this is an anime that you might also like, because of its focus on theworkplace and bits of romance between the characters. If you have not seen this anime, then I highly recommend that you watch it and if you have already seen it, then watch it again because the anime is something that I cannot forget.


Story: 9/10 - The anime ended on a good note but if it were possible, I really wish it were longer or had a second season.


Art: 9/10- The action scenes are well animated and characters really show good emotion in the faces


Character: 10/10- Each character in the anime has interesting interactions and portray funny anime archetypes

~Giant Cat's Opinion's (*≧ω≦*): Wahhhhh I really loved this anime it was funny,it was charming and it was memorable. "Sadou Maou" was a very funny and quirky character,"Ashiya" (Sadou's second in command) was AWESOME he was always funny,Emi Yusa (Emilia the Hero) took a little bit of time to get used to due to her tsundere nature.Her tsundereness got annoying sometimes but she was a good character and CHIHO WAS SO ADORABLE! Lucifer was a great Relatable character as well. My only problem with the series is....WHERES SEASON 2!!! PRODUCERS CREATORS I NEED SEASON 2..wahhh I mean season 2 would be nice.
I love this seriesI give it a 9/10

The Devil is a Part-Timer had an outstanding story at the beginning and middle, but as the anime reached the end of the season, things were anticlimactic considering it was a finale. I would also like Ente Isla to be more expansive and add to the story more than it did. However, it was a super funny show and a great slice of life, but the action/different world/devil part was a little lacking. The last episode did not even end on a cliffhanger for the following season (which may not even happen). More plot twists and more things happening would have been good for thestory to meet its full potential. The art was good but nothing special, while the soundtrack added intensity and emotion. Despite the slightly lacking story, I really enjoyed this anime and it was funny and I would recommend it IF a second season would come. Or just read the manga. \n\n
magegay out

"The anime delivered good laughs made even more entertaining by funny exchanges, witty retorts, and expressive faces. Humor was the show's strongest point. It was lightweight, easy, and funny to watch. It may have walked on thin ice by injecting a little bit of action and a little bit of drama here and there. Part of the anime's appeal was that it stayed faithful to comedy: It would build up fluff between characters with emotions are never too heavy to carry. It would insert a well drawn action scene and pull back just in time for another gag.
At the heart of Hataraku Maou-sama! were thesilly slice-of-life moments stringed together to make a funny story. It makes fun of the mundane things, and pokes at an ordinary person's daily worries (and expenses). The good thing about it is how all the complicated things took a backseat to comedy. Hataraku Maou-sama! is best appreciated in its simplicity. A plot any deeper would have taken away the humor from the show."

To me the title sounded like just another cliched anime. An unearthly being finds himself on earth and hence tries to adjust himself in it. But I enjoyed this anime as a good pass time, only because of one of the Maaou Sama's sidekick.

Overall: Good pass time.\n

Hataraku Maou-sama
I thought I wouldn't enjoy this series, but watching it proved me very wrong. At first look, its not that very appealing for me, so I was thinking twice on watching it since I thought it was going to be your average romcom harem ecchi fanservice series. But what do you know, you can never judge a book by its cover. 
Story : 7
Not very original if you ask me. In a separate world, there was a demon king who conquered every village on it, and of course! If there's a demon king, there's a hero. The hero and her allies then defeats threeof the four generals who assists the demon king himself, and reclaims the villages. And then she gets to the demon king's castle to finally defeat the demon king, which she successfully did. The demon king one of his general were forced to retreat, used some kind of a portal which leads them to earth. There they lost most of their power, unable to retain their demon forms and unable to go back to their world because of they're wounds and not having enough magic power, they were forced to stay on earth. 




Art : 9

The art is reaaaaaaaaaally good. We rarely see ugly art in this modern day and age, so almost everything now is pretty well made. Backgrounds were perfectly drawn. Detailed background characters. Its really good. Period.




Characters : 8

Characters on hataraku maou-sama. They're good, easily recognizable, names that doesn't have much of a problem to remember, cute, and very detailed. So you'll remember them very easily. They're personalities match well with their looks, and perfectly works with their co-characters.




Music : 8

Music is good. Cute ending, I didint quite like the opening though, but the ending is quite good. You should listen to it when you start watching it.




Enjoyment : 9

I really enjoyed it. Since I gave it a 9, its kind of refreshing to watch this kind series. No deep or complicated plots. It just gives you the "this carefree feel" when you watch it.




Overall : 8

Its a good series, pretty decent, not that ecchi. Its really worth watching, it has the potential of having a great action packed series if the makers pursue that path, but the rom com feel to it is not that bad either, its not entirely harem though, since unlike other series, this one doesn't have that much of girls frolicking over the protag, in fact others really resent him. Plus the light jokes are really good, they'll put a little laugh on your tummy. And they're really easy to catch, you don't need to understand japanese to get the jokes, unlike other series, which relies on puns on making jokes. This series is a good watch, not really a must-watch series though. But it probably won't waste your time, so that covers my review on this one! Have fun watching hataraku maou-sama!

There are no spoilers in this review.  I give this anime a 5.6.
For those looking for a brief summary, skip to the “Overall” at the bottom of this review. 
Story: 6
This anime took the classic story of someone trying for world domination and made it into a comedy. It definitely had potential but after the first few episodes it became literally just another harem anime. By the 7th episode I wanted to drop the anime but held out until the end and regret it.
Characters: 4
What threw me off about this anime were the implausible characters. The only person who got a backstory throughout thisentire anime was Yusa, and an excellent one at that. Unfortunately, they took any hint of drama that would have given the show substance and ruined it with poor comedy. I had a few laughs, but the 1-dimensional characters and poor execution of the plot made this anime feel like the creators of One Punch Man tried too hard to make a serious anime and fell into their satirical ways halfway through each dramatic scene.  


Art: 7


The art was decent. Nothing amazing, but at least not as terrible as the characters.


Sound: 6


The sound didn’t stand out to me either. I’m just giving it less than a 7 because of my sheer disappointment with this anime.


Overall: 5.6


The story was world domination with a nice twist. Unfortunately, the 1-dimensional characters ruined any chance this story had of succeeding and the poor comedy took out any morsel of substance this show had. It felt like the creators of One Punch Man tried too hard to make a serious anime and fell into their satirical ways halfway through each dramatic scene. Art and sound were decent but nothing to brag about. Even if there is a season 2, I will not be watching it. Huge disappointment.

Hataraku Maou-sama!
Story (8)
Hataraku Maou-sama hooked me in, It started with 2 "Devilry" creatures are forced to drift to the other world: modern-day Tokyo.
The story follows Maou (Devil King) and his right hand man Ashiya's daily lives, Adapting to the new world, learning the culture and the ways in Japan and even getting a job and other "Real Life" things people need to learn. I found this aspect to the show rather rewarding to watch and kept the meaning of the series rather being just another Slice Of Life focusing on Characters ONLY. The balance is nice and adds elements and story twists that worked forthe series.


Art (9)


* Backdrops are really stunning at points

* Characters are very diverse stylistically 

* Characters also easily show slight emotions which was nice to see


Sound (9)


* OP - Was decent enough and catchy with the opening part of "Get out of gate"

* ED - Was nice nothing to complain about, Her voice is really good. 

* Characters - All suited themselves for example Chiho's sounded Vulnerable yet feisty and Maou sounds nice when Normal, but you can tell he has a deeper/dark side to his voice which suited both of them.


Characters (8)


The characters drove the story forward and each different from one another, The slight issue is many characters are left rather one dimensional, Hardly focus on any bits in the past apart from some people from the "Other World" which for some hardly give any information, Just a simple instruction or goal. 

I felt they needed to explore these further to give some depth to the characters, And they simply played on the little we know way too many times, For example knowing why Emi putting up a tough and uncompromising front when talking to/about  Maou is something that got overused far too many times.


But don't get me wrong, I liked the characters i just wanted a bit more to round them off and give them needed depth.


Enjoyment (8)


Hataraku Maou-sama! is a really enjoyable series for me, Has decent characters and interesting and unique story and is pulled off rather well, Would defiantly recommend this series to you if you have watched Maoyuu Maou Yuusha (Maou Sama is better) or Ichiban Ushiro no Daimaou etc.

This is one show I haven't regret watching. Hataraku Maou-sama is one of the best things that I have ever witnessed. After the 1st episode, it just got better and better.
A little bit of spoilers ahead:
Story = 8 - The story was quite new for me. Basically, it's about a Demon Lord who was at verge of defeat in his world and escaped with his remaining General to earth. Upon arriving, they noticed they can't use magic and conquering that world would be pointless, so they decided to live like humans.
Art = 8 - Everything was animated excellently, be it a normal day in theirlives or battle scenes, the art is great.


Sound = 8 - I have nothing against the OP, because it's very good. As for BGM, I have no qualms about it because, it fits in every scene.


Character = 9 - This shows has a cast of great seiyuus w/c helped with how popular it got.


Maou Sadao/ Demon Lord Satan Jacob - The MC, when he arrived at Earth, he became a caring and big-brother figure to Chi-chan. He is a very powerful Demon, because he is the King of all Demons, so he is very OP and draws his power from fear, despair, etc.


Ashiya Shirou/Alciel - His like the Housekeeper whenever Maou is working, he is in-charge of budgeting and groceries, a  polite Demon, he fled to Earth after he and Maou were defeated in Ente Isla. He seems to have a thing for his mantle.


Emi Yusa/ Emillia the Hero - Was pursuing the fleeing Demon Lord, when she arrived at Earth, she lost her powers as well, she works as a call-center agent. I think she likes Maou. She gets a power up from "hope", but she doesn't know. She has a complex about her boobs.


Hanzou Urushihara/Lucifer - The first Antagonist of the show but, becomes an ally after Maou defeats him in battle. He becomes a NEET, and will only help out if Maou asks him too or if he feels like it.


Chiho Sasaki - Maou's cute and loud co-worker. She didn't mind Maou and the others not being human. Even knowing about Maou's true self, she still likes him. Currently in the kouhai zone.


Suzuno Kamazuki - an assassin sent by Ente Isla to kill Maou and take the other-half, after realizing her mistakes, she joins Maou and his underlings.


Olba Meyer - the "priest" in Emi's party. Had an ulterior motive.


Mitsuki Sarue/ Arch-angel Sariel - Go home James, this isn't pokemon. He tried to take the other-half from Emilia only to be thwarted by Maou.


Enjoyment = 9 - The action isn't over the top... sometimes. Whenever there is a serious scene they can squeeze in some comedy to lessen the tension and that makes this show a little unique than the other Maou-Yuusha type animes.


Overall = 9 - If anything in this world deserves a Season 2, it's this one. Fights are well animated, dialogue is superb, the timing of jokes is greatly executed, and the whole angel bad-guy/devil good-guy thing will make Catholics go wild but, it just depends on your perspective.

Hataraku Maou-sama!
(The Devil is a Part Timer) ...
...Is a fun and hilarious show.
This show has a very serious premise, but light-heartedly is absolutely hilarious.
The story is simple, yet it has to be. If it tried any harder it would ruin the humor aspect of the show.
It's a comedy, so if you like laughing without ingesting alcohol it's a good time.
I mean who wouldn't want to see Satan working at a fast food joint?
Just when you blamed the devil for that karma last week, you'l be rest assured he's making minimum wage.
Although I am fond of this show, the story ends too quickly and more couldbe accomplished. That's the only bicker I have with it.

I got across Hataraku Maou-sama by looking for Animes similar to Working!!, one way or another they may be similar but just a tad bit IMHO. 
Either way, I enjoyed the anime quite well. It's funny and I watched the whole series in one day (which means I find it interesting).
The only problem I have is that I get annoyed with the character called Chiho. I find her character irrelevant same goes with her bust line. But that is just my opinion though...(I would rate higher if she was not there.)
That said, I recommend this anime for those who are looking for nothing serious.

If You're looking for non-stop action and ultimate "badassery", look somewhere else.
I did my best to avoid spoilers in this review , but just in case... "you have been warned"
Hataraku Maou-sama! (the devil is a part timer), takes a step back the recently popular insane violence and gore, by cutting out the all the unnecessary fights which ultimately don't affect the plot, whilst still retaining the quirky and often ingenious outbursts making a downright hilarious show.
Story 8
I reckon there's about 8 people for each anime that introduces a supernatural element to it along the way ( i.e. there's a lot). However Hataraku Maou-sama! open withthe main character of Satan... that's right... Satan, the physical manifestation of all things dark and evil (」・ω・)」 As his expanding empire is crippled and he is forced to leave the dimension. And where does he arrive? Our world of course, a world devoid of all magic and demonic beings (depending on your faith). So as he attempts to replenish his magic and return to his world he faces the greatest challenge ever to the dark overlord: working in... the service industry. With a couple other spanners thrown in the works along the way.

It comes as no surprise that such an outsider takes a little while to acclimatise into our world making for plenty of situations or just little phrases that can have you doubling over, laughing at the screen like a madman.


Art 9


This has one of the best art styles, I've seen in a long time, ranging from semi-opaque darkness to vibrant, in your face lighting darting around.


Sound 5


Given that the dub had not yet been released when I saw this anime, I cannot judge the voice acting so this is based purely upon sound effects and music, unfortunately both of these seemed quite rare or simply went unnoticed; evident as I can hardly remember the theme tune, the exception to this for me though was the ending theme, which sadly I didn't bother to watch until about halfway through.


Character 8


With the story of Satan, you would expect a harsh, manipulative person with little concern for others, however this anime goes out of it's way that he is anything but that, helping humans whenever possible, the stereotype defying    not stopping there, as most of the main characters are revealed to be almost the reverse of their reputation.


Overall 8


This was a brilliant anime which I would recommend to anyone with the remotest of interests with fantasy, comedy, slice of life or even romance - none of which interfere with each other at any point, somehow - and you won't regret watching even if that doesn't include you.

p.s

If the dub sucks (as always) try it on subs, don't just give up on it.

“I don’t expect a mere human to understand my lofty goals.”
I was told this show was absolutely hilarious, and “probably best of the season”, and while I may not know about the latter, I can honestly say that this is one of the funniest shows I have seen.
Story: (8 / 10)
To be honest, this show would’ve probably worked just as well as a regular SOL-show, without any of the demon stuff. Each episode we get to follow the daily lives of the dark lord Maou Sadao and other characters involved in his life, as he works his way up in the fast-food business. 
To spicethings up even more, we have the occasional being from another dimension show up, to cause trouble for our hardworking lord. 


New characters are introduced now and then throughout the series, some more permanent than others, and this makes for a nice change of pace, as the characters will always have someone new to interact with. 


I personally never had any problems with the pacing of the show. Not once did I feel like an episode was moving too slow or too fast, however the final episode will really leave you wanting for a second season...


Art: (8 / 10)

While the art may not be the best of the season, it’s certainly nowhere near bad, either. The backgrounds were beautiful most of the time, and I especially loved the character designs. The demons weren’t too over-the-top, but still got the point across, while every human character looked unique and very much had their own “style”. 


The art helped in bringing out the humor a lot of the times as well, mostly through certain facial expressions which served to really enhance a characters reaction.

The animation and effects were nicely done, and there’s really nothing to complain about at all. 


Sound: (8 / 10)

The OP, “ZERO!!” by Minami Kuribayashi, is a pretty upbeat song, which perfectly fits the lighthearted tone of the show. The three ED’s used, “Tsuki Hana”, “Star Chart”, and “Tsumabiku Hitori” are all performed by nano.RIPE and have a slightly less upbeat tone. I thought they worked very well in contrast to the rest of the series. 


The characters all have fitting voices, and there was no character whose voice I really had a problem with. The voice actors did an overall great job in delivering their lines, and the expressions of the characters, which only served to make it all even funnier. 


Characters: (9 / 10)

Characters is a big one for this show. On one hand we have Maou Sadao, the dark lord from another world, who’s now working at MgRonalds and will do anything to help his crew out. Then we have Yusa Emi, the supposed hero of another world, who spend her days stalking Maou & friends. It makes for a weird change when the dark lord is the one constantly helping out, as opposed to the hero of the story, but in this case it definitely works. 


The other characters introduced all have rather unique personalities, and this large, varying cast of characters really help keep everything fresh as the show goes on. Almost all of the characters introduce serve an important purpose in the story, and are not just there as filler characters for a single episode, and then never seen again. 


Enjoyment: (10 / 10)

“Hataraku Maou-sama!” is a genuinely funny show. Not once was I bored during an episode, and even during what might appear to be more serious parts of an episode (like a fight scene) there were some hilarious things going on. There are some recurring jokes, but they never felt overused, and it’s nothing that will stay on your mind with all the other jokes happening throughout the series. 


Pros:

+ Absolutely hilarious

+ Art is good

+ High rewatch value

+ Unique, varying characters

+ Suzuno 

-----------------------

Cons:

- It will leave you wanting for more...

- Not enough screentime for Suzuno...

Part-timer is just another light novel adaptation that grazed the anime landscape like many that have come before and after it. A work that pulls its viewers/readers in not through its excellent storytelling and characterization, but rather through it’s atypical premise and how its able to pull the former around for a ride. Nonetheless the show still manages to be entertaining through its bits of comedy, production value, and more than normal characters.
Part-timer starts itself of in a generic fantasy world where good and evil are in a state of conflict. Good is able to prevail over the evil and our protagonist, the demon lord,makes an escape through the portal with one of his generals. This of course leads him to the human world because plot demands so. Not only are they in the human world, but they also have no magic except for the times they do but not enough to go back to their world. Now that they are stuck in the human world, they try their best to get a job and make a decent living in their new environment. Over the course of the series other characters from their previous world also start to pop-up, some of the good and others not so much. Despite their being being antagonists as well as some backdrop of a war in the fantasy world, there's very little action in the show. For the moments there are, they are fine but it's mostly in the protagonists favor as the plot demands that he regain an unknown amount of power to overpower everyone. The comedy of the show is fine as well although the use of pop culture/statistics is very unnecessary. For the most part the comedy comes from the subversion of expectations, but that gets over done early on in the show. It also doesn’t help that comedy supersedes everything from drama to tension leading to a lot of tonal whiplash.the show, like most LN adaptations, has a short run-time leaving the story incomplete, and ends on a rather boring note. 


The main cast of characters are rather 2-dimensional at best for the most. They each have some sort of characterization and development that doesn’t make them flat, but not enough that makes them well rounded individuals. They are mostly there for the service of the premise with the heroes and villains being the inverse of what they usually should be. The demons for the most part being nice and law abiding, and the heroes being more antagonistic. There’s not much more to it than the fact that being the inverse is in some way suppose to be funny since it’s a subversion of expectation. The interactions that the characters have with each other is entertaining and funny, but that as well starts to feel repetitive by the end of the show. They’re just funny caricatures that are in service of the premise. 


The production value of this show fluctuates between being pretty good to just painfully average.the character designs are very generic, but are also very appropriate and appealing for this kind of show. The background designs are fine as well from contemporary japan, and the small bits of the fantasy world that are given a glimpse of. The animation for the show is also good at times not just the action scenes, but also just in movement in general. However there are also dips in graphic fidelity even in scenes where not much is happening. Still the best part of the show is the facial expressions of the characters and how they react to certain situation, although even that can come of as average with chio being the main example. The voice acting for the show is fine, most of it is average but they work well with the characters. The soundtrack is a mix of light poppy songs and fantasy orchestrals. Both are fine for the most part, but mostly unmemorable and usually undercut from the characters talking.


Part-time is just an ok show to sit down, watch, laugh a bit, and throw aside. It’s a show just made for entertainment and hopes that the viewers can be entertained from it.... And to buy the light novels.

[EDIT: I NO LONGER AGREE WITH THIS REVIEW]
I'd say this is easily one of the funniest anime I've ever seen. This is due to fact that they not just make jokes, but they also poke fun at modern things. I still remember the line where they subtly mocked the script of the Bee Movie. The idea of Satan using his leadership abilities to work at ripoff McDonald's and his servant basically turning into his mother was a great set up for comedy. What I love most is that the main characters' story episodes show a serious backstory and then the next episode you'll see themeating noodles with their enemy. I personally didn't like Emilia but she was a reminder that these people do have supernatural abilities, and with that constant reminder,the overall premise doesn't get boring. The comedy was solid, the premise was unique and hilarious, the characters for the most part were nice, the art animation were a okay, and I enjoyed this very much. Everyone should watch it if they want a good laugh. However, towards the end, there are some serious parts. This part of the story isn't really at memorable. If you were to ask people what they thought of the show, they probably wouldn't even bring those points up and just talk about the comedy.

I dont like to write large reviews because i want people to form their own opinion about a certain anime and decide for themselves but i do write stuff that will help you to judge whether its watchable or not.
Hataraku Maou sama is indeed very watchable with a very different and unique plot.One can think that they are in for a ride with this anime having all the elements that is action, comedy, demons, slice of life and what not and they are put together very well and i praise the creators for doing so. 
This show is about a demon overlord and his secretarywho were  overthrowed from ente isla(where he ruled) and now  seek refuge in our world where there is no magic or supernatural beings or elements and while they reside here they  search for magic and power to enter their own realm .BUt the search for power isnt only the issue as they have to go on with their daily lives and have to eat ofcourse.


It is very well written and uses pop culture references like harry potter and others.We follow the daily routines of these two foreigners which is packed with hilarious moments.I mean u cant stop laughing while watching this show. Also there are battles which change the pace of the show.


What i love about the show is how these demonic duo in human forms struggle with their daily lives and are able to show so much innocence and pure heartness but that is also the weak point as in why they show such innocence when they were supposed to be bad enough to be overthrowed. This change sure seems forced but the story does not go deep into it.


Our protagonist acquires a simple day job at mcronalds (ripped from MCdonalds)which seems to be fun almost me wanting to work there(that wont happen).


Finally i would like to say that those who like comedy and even those who dont must watch this show and i am sure you will have laughs all way long.

*Viewership on dubbed*
I had gone into the anime with the mindset that there is gonna be some pretty cool action. Oh what a pleasant surprise I had when our MC had to escape his world.
Our MC's old world, he ruled it, he conquered it, till that day when the world fought back. He manages to escape, but not without sticking out like a sore thumb. Lacking the knowledge of the land, the locals, and the language, our MC struggles to get by.
The hilarity of our casts' adjustment to the world was a blast to watch. Their interactions with other humans and how they mentally processhow and what things are is one fun journey to witness.\n\n
The greatest shining parts is the characters. One in particular for me was the right hand man of our MC, who has amazing loyalty to a fault and the lines of perfection. The English voice actors had a great time and so did I.\n\n
I ended up getting McGronalds...uh I mean, McDonalds, twice because of this show. Man, I still have a stupid grin whenever I think of this show.\n\n
I direly recommend it to be watched dubbed. We all have fun here in McGronalds.

I'm going to tell you right off the bat that this anime is HILARIOUS. If you want a good comedy anime, this is the one. I have never laughed so much while watching an anime. Just the whole plot itself is funny. Satan comes to Earth and works at McDonalds??? That has to be funny. What sets this anime apart from most others is that some comedy anime nowadays rely heavily on fan service to be funny. Like generic girl with big boobs falls on pervert guy. I thought it was going to be like that, but NONE of that in this anime. I meanthis anime created hilarious situations and it paid off. The jokes, the situations, the characters, the interactions, all just so funny and well done.


I loved this anime and all, but there were minor things that I would like to bring up. Although the main character gave his reasoning for his change in attitude on Earth, I just don't buy it. He goes from being a world conqueror, to what he is in the anime? I can overlook that because I like he grows as a character and I respect and root for him.


Overall, this anime had me dying of laughter. Good clean humor. I wish that there could be more anime like this instead of the anime adding fan service which sometimes makes the anime uncomfortable to watch and takes away from the humor if used wrong. I don't want you guys to think that I hate fan service , but when it takes away from the anime, that's when I don't like it. That's beside the point though, this anime was hilarious and I like each of the characters and I liked how everyone developed over the episodes.

First thing you need to know, before starting this anime, is that you will be (very) disappointed by the end. Now that you're aware of this, let's continue. 
I enjoyed watching this anime for several reasons. First, I really liked the character of Maou-Sama, even though I was expecting him to be more profound with time but not really (we don't really learn much about him actually). Secondly, I really enjoyed the jokes. This anime is a com, and it made me laugh a lot, so I would say it reached its achievements about that. What I liked is that there is humour even inthe most inappropriate scenes. You don't see it coming, you are worried and everything then BAM you laugh hysterically. That's what Hataraku Maou-Sama did to me. \n
But there is a big lack of story, sadly. No real progress and the end is... Im not ready to talk about the end. Im not sure I will get over this disappointment haha. \n
Anyway, a good serie to laugh, easy to watch, with some great characters (I really enjoyed Maou and Alciel), but don't expect too much.

I just finished watching this anime and I have to say I'm really glad I picked it up.  I honestly didn't really know what to expect and I think that's what this show excels at.  On the cover it really doesn't seem like much.  I have seen a bunch of "demon king no yadadadadas" popping up recently and they haven't really gotten a good rep.  I can say for sure though this is worth the watch.  The humor is the best amount of simple (not entirely too stupid, but still has those classic anime gags you see).  The actionis good; there's nothing entirely groundbreaking or special about it, but it still looks nice.  The characters are great and watching them interact is why the show is enjoyable.


I do have some more critical points I want to make.  I personally didn't understand the reason for the school episode (Episode ).  It seemed like a filler if anything ad they probably could have thought of something more creative and original.  But I guess that's fiction for you.


Beyond that though I have nothing really terrible to say about the show.  I wouldn't say it's one of the bests, but it's great and worth the watch for 13 episodes.  This is originally a series of light novels, so be on the look out for a possible season 2 if you're a fan.

Devil is a Part-timer in a word: Delicious
